hanzi-su-wiki:
購

Значения

Покупать, приобретать

Мнемоника

Денежные 貝 леса 冓, т.е. покрытие деньгами со всех сторон. Согласно древнему правилу, вещь стоила не дороже тех денег, которые покрывали её поверхность сплошным слоем.

Варианты

购

heisig_chinese_memo: A purchase is like a money funnel, because the receiving end is small (just one company) and the other end is wide (the whole country).
heisig_constituent: subscription, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, funnel, cone, celery, again
heisig_story: Shells . . . funnel. The key word is meant to suggest magazine subscriptions and the like.
koohiiStory1: Subscription is like a money funnel, because the receiving end is small (just one company) and the other end is wide (the whole country).
koohiiStory2: My subscription to Money magazine came with a free coin funnel.
jp_example_words:
購読(こうどく): subscription (e.g. magazine)
購入(こうにゅう): purchase, buy
購買(こうばい): purchase, buy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Picture shellfish lifeguard. They're not going anywhere. First, they're a shellfish, so they can't really move. And, they're a lifeguard, so they need to be in their lifeguard tower. How does this shellfish lifeguard get stuff? Through subscription services.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: See a bunch of subscription boxes around the lifeguard tower. It gets everything this way.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The shellfish lifeguard's favorite subscription is its subscription to こういち magazine. It has all the latest こういち versions, news, and interviews.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
See the shellfish lifeguard drooling as its こういち magazine subscription arrives. "I will read this one now, but I can't wait until next month," it says as a boat sinks in the distance.
Hint: when you see the "lifeguard" radical, the reading is probably going to be こう.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 構 (かまえる、コウ строение, поза, забота, беспокойство о чём-то), 講 (コウ лекция), 溝 (みぞ、どぶ、コウ канава).

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) from the well again (冓) is purchased
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Purchase a cast made from shellfish.  They are the cheapest.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " Bei " and "冓", the original meaning is to offer a reward, offer a reward for arrest. "Said Wen": "Seek money with money. Cong Bei, 冓声." "Warring States Policy‧Han Ce II": "Han took Nie Zheng's corpse in the city, and the county bought the daughter."

" Buy " means reward. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Preface to the Southern Barbarian Yis in Nanban": "It is a visit to the world, and there is a general who can win the canine war, General Wu, who buys gold thousand yi, Yi Wanjia, and wives as girls.

" Buy " also means redemption. "Suishu·Art Biography·Yu Jicai": "Today Ying is defeated, the ruler is guilty, no matter what the blame is for the gentry! I am a prisoner, dare not offer words, sincerely mourn, so I redeem my ears."

" Buy " also means asking for it. Tang Liu Yuxi's "Wu Ling North Pavilion": "Since my rule is in Sri Lanka, I have purchased materials from my apprenticeship, and a great deal of waste arises."

" Buy " also means to buy. Tang Peizheng "Legendary: Xiao Kuang": "If anyone buys it, it must be ten thousand dollars."

" Purchase " also refers to bounty, remuneration. Yuan Song version of "Gong Prison": "Sneak to the soil couch, pull bricks to make a fight, and the corpse will see you. The workers broke in, paid for the secret purchase, and received women and sent officials."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " Bei " and "冓", the original meaning is to offer a reward, offer a reward for arrest.
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，「冓」聲，本義為懸賞徵求、懸賞緝捕。《說文》：「以財有所求也。从貝，冓聲。」《戰國策‧韓策二》：「韓取聶政屍於市，縣購之千金。」

　　「購」可表示獎賞。《後漢書‧南蠻西南夷傳序》：「乃訪募天下，有能得犬戎之將吳將軍頭者，購黃金千鎰，邑萬家，又妻以少女。」

　　「購」也表示贖取。《隋書‧藝術傳‧庾季才》：「今郢都覆敗，君信有罪，搢紳何咎，皆為賤隸！鄙人羈旅，不敢獻言，誠切哀之，故贖購耳。」

　　「購」還表示求取。唐劉禹錫〈武陵北亭記〉：「自吾之治於斯也，購徒庀材，大起堙廢。」

　　「購」亦表示買。唐裴鉶《傳奇‧蕭曠》：「若有胡人購之，非萬金不可。」

　　「購」也指賞金，酬金。元宋本〈工獄〉：「偷遽去土榻席，扳磚作欲擊鬥狀，則屍見矣。眾工突入，償偷購，反接婦送官。」
humanum_short_description: 從「貝」，「冓」聲，本義為懸賞徵求、懸賞緝捕。

購読(こうどく): subscription (e.g. magazine)
購入(こうにゅう): purchase, buy
購買(こうばい): purchase, buy

從「 貝 」，「 冓 」聲，本義為懸賞徵求、懸賞緝捕。《說文》：「以財有所求也。从貝，冓聲。」《戰國策‧韓策二》：「韓取聶政屍於市，縣購之千金。」 「 購 」可表示獎賞。《後漢書‧南蠻西南夷傳序》：「乃訪募天下，有能得犬戎之將吳將軍頭者，購黃金千鎰，邑萬家，又妻以少女。」 「 購 」也表示贖取。《隋書‧藝術傳‧庾季才》：「今郢都覆敗，君信有罪，搢紳何咎，皆為賤隸！鄙人羈旅，不敢獻言，誠切哀之，故贖購耳。」 「 購 」還表示求取。唐劉禹錫〈武陵北亭記〉：「自吾之治於斯也，購徒庀材，大起堙廢。」 「 購 」亦表示買。唐裴鉶《傳奇‧蕭曠》：「若有胡人購之，非萬金不可。」 「 購 」也指賞金，酬金。元宋本〈工獄〉：「偷遽去土榻席，扳磚作欲擊鬥狀，則屍見矣。眾工突入，償偷購，反接婦送官。」
From the sound of " Bei" and " 冓", the original meaning is to offer a reward, offer a reward for arrest. "Said Wen": "Seek money with money. Cong Bei, 冓声." "Warring States Policy‧Han Ce II": "Han took Nie Zheng's corpse in the city, and the county bought the daughter." " Buy" means reward. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Preface to the Southern Barbarian Yis in Nanban": "It is a visit to the world, and there is a general who can win the canine war, General Wu, who buys gold thousand yi, Yi Wanjia, and wives as girls. " Buy" also means redemption. "Suishu·Art Biography·Yu Jicai": "Today Ying is defeated, the ruler is guilty, no matter what the blame is for the gentry! I am a prisoner, dare not offer words, sincerely mourn, so I redeem my ears." " Buy" also means asking for it. Tang Liu Yuxi's "Wu Ling North Pavilion": "Since my rule is in Sri Lanka, I have purchased materials from my apprenticeship, and a great deal of waste arises." " Buy" also means to buy. Tang Peizheng "Legendary: Xiao Kuang": "If anyone buys it, it must be ten thousand dollars." " Purchase" also refers to bounty, remuneration. Yuan Song version of "Gong Prison": "Sneak to the soil couch, pull bricks to make a fight, and the corpse will see you. The workers broke in, paid for the secret purchase, and received women and sent officials."

購字的基本解释

購
gòu
见“购”。

購字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gòu］
［《廣韻》古候切，去候，見。］
“购1”的繁体字。
(1)悬赏征求；悬赏缉捕。
(2)奖赏。
(3)指赏金，酬金。
(4)赎取。
(5)求取。
(6)买。
(7)买通。
(8)通“媾”。讲和；和解。

購字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　購； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1211第21
【唐韻】古?切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】居?切，?音構。【說文】以財有所求也。【史記·韓世家】將西購於秦。【前漢·高帝紀】乃多以金購豨將。【註】師古曰：購，設賞募也。　又草名。【爾雅·釋草】購，蔏簍。【註】舍人曰：購，一名蔏蔞。　又【集韻】居侯切，音鉤。義同。

[①]［gòu］
["Guangyun" ancient waiting cut, go waiting, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "购1".
(1) Offer a reward for solicitation; offer a reward for arrest.
(2) Rewards.
(3) Refers to bounty, remuneration.
(4) Redemption.
(5) Obtain.
(6) Buy.
(7) Buy-through.
(8) Through "媾". Make peace; reconcile.

[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　Go; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1211 No. 21
[Tang Yun] Ancient? Cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Inhabit? Cut, sound structure. [Said the text] Seek something with money. 【Historical Records·Han Family】Buy West from Qin Dynasty. [Previous Han·Gao Di Ji] The generals were purchased with gold. [Note] Shigu said: Buy, set up rewards.　Also cursive name. 【Erya·Shucao】Buy, a basket. gòu
вм. 购
Radicals: 貝, 冓  (shellfish, lifeguard)
Meaning Mnemonic
Picture shellfish lifeguard. They're not going anywhere. First, they're a shellfish, so they can't really move. And, they're a lifeguard, so they need to be in their lifeguard tower. How does this shellfish lifeguard get stuff? Through subscription services.
See a bunch of subscription boxes around the lifeguard tower. It gets everything this way.
Reading Mnemonic
The shellfish lifeguard's favorite subscription is its subscription to こういち magazine. It has all the latest こういち versions, news, and interviews.
See the shellfish lifeguard drooling as its こういち magazine subscription arrives. "I will read this one now, but I can't wait until next month," it says as a boat sinks in the distance.
Hint: when you see the "lifeguard" radical, the reading is probably going to be こう.
